title: Qi Zhang
text:
Hi, I am Qi Zhang, an assistant professor at WPI. I work on building collaborative AI agents. My research interests are in formalisms, theories, and algorithms of single- and multi-agent planning and reinforcement learning.
2025 - Now    Assistant Professor, CS/AI @ WPI  2020 - 2025   Assistant Professor, CSE/AI @ U of South Carolina  2015 - 2020   PhD, CSE @ UMich
Email: qzhang9 at wpi.edu      Office: Unity Hall 355
CV / Research Statement
 I am looking for PhD students and visiting researchers! 




Selected Papers
 Google Scholar

Reinforcement Learning with Euclidean Data Augmentation for State-Based Continuous Control  Jinzhu Luo, Dingyang Chen, Qi Zhang  NeurIPS 2024   [arXiv]
Efficient Sequential Decision Making with Large Language Models  Dingyang Chen, Qi Zhang, Yinglun Zhu  EMNLP 2024   [arXiv]
E(3)-Equivariant Actor-Critic Methods for Cooperative Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning  Dingyang Chen, Qi Zhang  ICML 2024   [arXiv]
Context-Aware Bayesian Network Actor-Critic Methods for Cooperative Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning  Dingyang Chen, Qi Zhang  ICML 2023   [openreview]
Convergence and Price of Anarchy Guarantees of the Softmax Policy Gradient in Markov Potential Games  Dingyang Chen, Qi Zhang, Thinh T. Doan  ICML 2022 DARL Workshop   [arXiv]
Communication-Efficient Actor-Critic Methods for Homogeneous Markov Games  Dingyang Chen, Yile Li, Qi Zhang  ICLR 2022   [openreview]

title: Qi Zhang
text:
CS 525 - ST: Multi-Agent Decision Making (Fall 2025)
 Time & Location: Tuesday & Friday, 4-5:20 pm. Fuller Labs 320.


Lecture notes

Lecture 1 MDP Basics and Planning
Lecture 2a Generative Models: Monte Carlo Tree Search
Lecture 2b Generative Models: Certainty-Equivalence
Lecture 3a RL Setting, Multi-Armed Bandit
Lecture 3b Taxonomy of RL Algorithms, Q-Learning
Lecture 3c Policy Optimization
Lecture 4 Normal-Form Games
Lecture 5 Markov Games
